definitions.definition: To bestow commendation on; to represent favourably; to suggest , endorse or encourage as an appropriate choice.
examples: The board recommends Philips, given his ample experience in similar positions.

definitions.definition: To make acceptable ; to attract favor to.
examples: A city that has much to recommend it.
The therapist recommends resting the mind and exercising the body.
My therapist recommended that I rest the mind and exercise the body.

definitions.definition: To commit , confide to another's care, confidence or acceptance, with favoring representations
examples: A medieval oblate's parents recommended the boy for life to God and the monastery.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To bestow commendation on; to represent favourably; to suggest , endorse or encourage as an appropriate choice.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To make acceptable ; to attract favor to.
( transitive ) To advise , propose , counsel favorably
( transitive , archaic ) To commit , confide to another's care, confidence or acceptance, with favoring representations
